definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society

sentences.english: Today there are still horse caravans passing by every day.
sentences.chinese: 現在，每天都有馬幫從東壩經過。

sentences.english: A horse takes them on errands, and a kitchen garden helps keep them well fed.
sentences.chinese: 馬幫他們跑腿，廚房菜園使他們健康而營養充足。

sentences.english: After a year full of hardships.
Do you think you can easily park a caravan?
sentences.chinese: 你認爲你可以很容易地公園的馬幫？

sentences.english: I felt the caravan's life is too tough.
sentences.chinese: 我呀，覺得馬幫太辛苦了。
“舊房子”就是馬幫擋風避雨的地方。

pinyin: Xi3 ma3 la1 ya3 shan1 mai4

definition: old tea-horse road or southern Silk Road, dating back to 6th century, from Tibet and Sichuan through Yunnan and Southeast Asia, reaching to Bhutan, Sikkim, India and beyond
Ergun county level city, Mongolian Ergüne xot, in Hulunbuir 呼倫貝爾|呼伦贝尔[Hu1 lun2 bei4 er3], Inner Mongolia
no sign of human habitation (idiom); desolate
to pass over mountains ridges (idiom); fig. hardships of the journey
